name: Cordial Mogan Playa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel. Staff were brilliant and made our holiday. Food superb, rooms lovely and clean. Pool area great. Spa lovely and relaxing.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually stayed here in mid September, but only just adding review due to picking up germs on the flight home! Thanks fellow Easyjet passengers...
reviews.title: Beautiful place, fantastic break away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Hotel Boking – The reason I mention the booking is because I ended up booking direct through Cordial Resort Holidays. The package we got (although more money than I had wanted to pay) was pretty good and everything was included (10 days half board, private taxi transfer, flights etc). The customer service was good, I had a couple of questions after booking and they were answered promptly.
reviews.title: A balanced view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel - We arrived at about 10.30pm (flight landed at 8.30pm, plus its a good 40min transfer time from the airport), so we were too late for dinner but were told to ask for a lunch voucher on the day we checked out to compensate. We were given a very welcome glass of sparkling wine as the lady checked us in, which was followed by a (quite speedy) run down of what was where in the hotel. We had to choose what time we wanted to eat every night (there are 2 sittings to choose from, but we found that they were flexible if you wanted to change times, or even tables during your stay) despite what some staff may tell you at reception. Sadly we weren’t told about the hotel tour that happens every Friday, which would have been helpful as we didn’t have holiday rep. A couple we got talking to during the course of our stay went on one (they were told about it through their holiday rep) and said it was really useful (its a very large hotel with lots going on) and quite interesting, as it took you 'behind the scenes' of the hotel. We did get invited to a welcome drink for new arrivals a couple of days after we arrived which was nice but nothing was mentioned then either.
reviews.title: Another satisfied customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds of the hotel are AMAZING and completely immaculate. When you walk around you’ll find a canary cage, a cactus garden and an archaeological area complete with a few skeletons!
reviews.title: Very enjoyable
Wow, Excellent, Fabulous
reviews.text: We stayed at the Valle apartments next door over the New Year holidays and took the opportunity to have a short break at the 4*plus hotel next door. The Valle apartments were very good, but the sister hotel (Cordial Mogan Playa) next door is at another level again. From the warmth of the staff, to the huge and extensive buffet breakfast and dinner to the cleanliness of the grounds and rooms everything we found to be outstanding. We don't get to stay at high end accomodation very often but as this was low season we got a really good price, and maybe my experience is a little lacking of high end establishments but I can't imagine many hotels better than this one.

reviews.title: Quite good but nothing to get too excited about
reviews.text: The only slight downside was the cost of drinks at the pool side bar (3.50 euros for a beer, 6.10 euros for a bacardi and coke). But with a well stocked super market over the road it was cheaper to buy your own and self cater for pool side refreshments. No one seemed to mind.

reviews.title: Nice relaxing hotel with good facilities
reviews.text: In summary a truly fabulous hotel set in landscaped gardens which offers the best of everything. I for one will be returning!

reviews.title: Nice hotel in beautiful Puerto De Mogan
reviews.text: Just back from having spent a week here.

reviews.title: Fabulous holiday
reviews.text: I have to say that having read the reviews on Trip Advisor I was expecting an outstanding hotel. From my experience the place is just above average and flatters to deceive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After initially both seeing canaries as playa de las americas we are a bit reluctant canary travellers. However Puerto de Mogan is a really nice resort, nice child friendly little beach and lots of nice restaurants. Hotel was a very good 4 star other than restaurant.
reviews.title: Great apart from restaurant. Would go back but stay in apartments next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So restaurant - dinner split into 2 sittings - pre 7 and post 8. This is annoying when you have a child who might sleep at any time. However, this is done because hotel has too many rooms to cope with a single sitting which you see at 8.30-9.15 at breakfast. Its a very stressful experience trying not to bump into anyone/finding a free table if you want to eat t this time. Second and bigger issue is the quality of food is poor - omelettes poured from a bottle (worst i ever had ) / fruit tinned (fine if good tinned but not anywhere near del monte) and pasta sauces awful. Bread was good and carved meat also good but queues reflected this.often ran out of glasses so plastic cups used by lots of people.
reviews.title: A great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room was average size 2 singles put together but a bit tight with a cot in it.
reviews.title: Mid Term break October 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Playroom was good and worked with our 17 mth old when supervised. Opened a bit later than I would like - 11am(at which point pool would be fine) would prefer 9am.
reviews.title: Late summer sun in ideal relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Comparing to Tenerife sensatori (our alternative destination) - hotel rooms and hotel restaurants not as good but location nicer and heated pool was warmer/better designed for cooler weather than sensatori.Sensatori pirate pool probably better if it was warmer(ie may to september. Sensatori had more uk channels (sad but kids tv while toddler awake and homes under hammer when asleep is really good when you are stuck in room)
reviews.title: Super holiday - friendly staff
wnderful staff and exceptional gardens
reviews.text: First off, it should be noted that some of posted reviews here belong actually to Cordia Apartments and not the hotel. For instance, the hotel does not have any self-service laundry but only the same as other hotels with laundry service (leaving the white bag). The apartments are 3 star establishments while the hotel is 4+ stars. The apartments do not have AC but instead ceiling fan.

reviews.title: Cannot wait to return
reviews.text: We stayed two weeks and occupied two adjacent standard rooms. We were staying on the ground floor. Very few rooms of the higher floors might have some limited far view of the ocean. Room views are very varied in fact. Guests in rooms facing direct sun have the possibility of having their swim suits died on the racks provided in the balconies.

reviews.title: Hotel to remember!
reviews.text: The standard rooms that we occupied were good in size. The beds are a couple of beds (twin-bed). The beds are not the best quality, but we had no problems sleeping. There were not any extra pillows or cushions for sitting and watching TV. However we never asked and though we asked for an extra blanket it was provided virtually immediately. The fact that there are twin beds leads to house-keeping moving them in order to make the beds. This causes some noise for neighbors especially those who live at lower levels.

reviews.title: Large but comfortable, friendly hotel in a lovely, quiet resort.
reviews.text: There are 6 glasses in each room and a small fridge at no costs. If you request a mini-bar you have to ask for at least 6 items. I doubt that anyone uses mini-bars as a large supermarket is practically outside the hotel with half the same price. No coffee-maker or water boilers in rooms. There is however a courtesy room in block C with microwave oven. Neither are there any moisturizers or q-tips in the bathroom. The bathroom is otherwise great with extremely great water pressure and temperature. There is a tube with good quality shampoo/shower gel. There is a door separating the toilet from the rest of the bathroom and another door separating the bedroom from the corridor. These increase sound and light isolation, when someone wants to use the bathroom in the middle of the night.

reviews.title: good hotel shame about the food
reviews.text: There are two pools. We used only the larger one. They are extremely clean and with good depth, beginning from 0 to 1.6 m in depth. No diving allowed. The constant presence (actually 9-17) of a life guard made the pools free from people trying dangerous stuff. This was clearly demonstrated after these hours when some guest began their mischief. There is one baby pool and a total of three bubble pools. These bubble pools though somewhat with cold water give very good massage due to the high pressure of water. Honey-moon suites are said to have their own bubble pools.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our twelfth holiday in the Canaries - and the hotel ranks as one of the best. The impressive architecture, the cheerful staff and the beautifully maintained extensive gardens all contribute to a very relaxing holiday. Food is good (especially the fish cooked in front of you) and plentiful. There are two sittings and an allocated table so queues are minimised. There is a weekly behind-the-scenes tour which shows the hotel is well run and clean in all areas. There are several sports facilities, including a ten-pin bowling alley. For the size of the hotel the hard-working animation team are very few in number so organise fewer games and activities than in some hotels. However, this doesn't seem a problem to most guests (a well balanced mix of many European nationalities) who are happy to relax by the huge and well-heated pools. Ample sunbeds and parasols, but still the perennial reserving of sunbeds before breakfast despite the polite notices. Also some guests smoke in the area where the tai-chi and stretching exercises take place most mornings, which spoils the enjoyment for the participants of these activities. However, both the reservation of sunbeds and inconsiderate smokers are a difficult issue for most hotels.
reviews.title: Staff, architecture and sub-tropical gardens contribute to a very recommendable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a seven day holiday to Gran Canaria on the strength of the Trip Advisor reviews and because our best friends told us the weather was so good in Feb compared to UK. We left a very cold and snowy UK behind at half term. We arrived to warm sunshine. The hotel did not disappoint but the weather did, but not for long. We experienced a couple of amazing storms one of which left the hotel gardens pretty batterd but the gardeners soon had it looking tidy again, enormous potholes on the harbour road , a harbour resturant badly damaged and was so rare that the television crews arrived to report on the unsual weather. Overall .we had a fantastic time. Food was excellent, the fresh grilled fish was delicious and a wide choice offered for starters, mains and dessert. The hotel staff were helpful and polite, even the entertainment was amusing after a glass of wine. Little did we expect to end up one evening stroking a python!!! The resturant has two sittings but there is some flexiblity if you want to go into town for the evening. We can recommend the Irish Bar ( not somewhere we would normally go on hoiliday but football was calling) The staff at the Irish bar were very friendly and we can recommend the Irish coffee. We didnt leave the resort cos the weather in the hills/mountains didn't look too good. Puerto Morgan is a lovely small resort., low rise compared to the other resorts we passed on the way to Cordial. Like all the other reviewers we would not hesitate to return, we already checking out dates in September!!!
reviews.title: We thought we had left the potholes behind!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled here first week in march.weather just got better as the week went on,had sun all week.
reviews.title: very nice hotel,set in very lush gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with most other reviews on here,very nice hotel,in great settings.staff were helpful and friendly.Went half board,breakfasts were excellant,lots of choice and all fresh.
reviews.title: Paradise Revisited!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: swapped dinner for lunch twice,lunch is in the bottom restraunt (where the people in suites have breakfast ! ) and again was good.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Puerto Mogan in Gran Canaria for a couple of days in February to get a bit of sunshine. Weather was good, but it also rained quite heavy several times.
reviews.title: Good 4-star hotel for mass tourism

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Cordial Mogan Playa, which we chose based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor - my 'travel bible'.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in pretty fishing village
Relaxing Hotel for Winter Sunshine
reviews.text: Hotel was good, rooms are in very good condition and clean. Service was good in general and food in the restaurant mixed. There is a lot of choice for both buffet breakfast and dinner - some dishes are great, others are not. In February the majority of guests were older couples enjoying a holiday in the pleasant climate of the Canary Islands. Price of drinks was reasonable. We went to the spa, which I don't think is worth the extra money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My disappointment was Puerto Mogan in the sense that I expected a more authentic local village, but found a resort completely built for mass tourism same as other resorts - can't see what is authentic in Puerto Mogan. Compared to the other resorts, there doesn't seem to be much nightlife - it is oriented towards a more quite holiday.
reviews.title: Brilliant Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, Hotel Cordial Mogan Playa is good 4-star hotel if you like big hotels geared for mass tourism.
reviews.title: Avoid the hot dishes in the buffet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in October 2010 and left a full review of our stay which can be found way down the list. Having returned in October 2011, I am happy to report that the high standards have been maintained and I am a heartbeat away from booking for October 2012 as well.
reviews.title: High standards maintained

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I contacted the hotel prior to departure to request the same room that we had in 2010, which they kindly arranged for me. We had a couple of minor issues with the room but these were sorted quickly and with no fuss. Having stayed there previously, we were more street wise which enhanced the pleasure of our time there. The nightly entertainment was of a good quality and we were pleased to find the ten pin bowling alley which we somehow missed in 2010.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a small fridge in the rooms which used to be a minibar, but this is now an on request service so there's now plenty of room for your own cold drinks. 5 litre bottles of water for 1 Euro from the shop in reception represents good value.
reviews.title: Top Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, if you are looking for a place to chill out and have some late year sun, we are more than happy to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went here in late August and it was gorgeous! We went on a chill out holiday to eat, drink, swim, and do nothing. We thoroughly enjoyed the pools and the whole set up of the hotel. The staff were reasonably friendly and the gardens were lovely surrounding most of the grounds. We also got engaged!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Good, but not excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this place is like heaven i enjoyed every bit of it though i found it expensive but just loved it greats ervice great room i dont have any complains
reviews.title: its a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Cordial Mogan Playa
reviews.title: Excellant holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A most unusual layout for a hotel, not boring and repetitive blocks, but imaginative and tropical.
reviews.title: First rate holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Water and streams are used to effect and really enhance the the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Another excellent visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Reception was polite and efficient, we were shown to our room by a friendly porter who pointed out the salient points of the hotel as we went.
reviews.title: Have booked to return for 5th time - says it all!

aka: Cordial Mogan Playa Hotel Puerto De Mogan
description: This impressive resort represents a Canarian Village and consists of 9 different buildings. There are 487 rooms, distributed in 399 double rooms, 33 single rooms, 5 double suites and 50 junior suites. There isn't a feeling of being in a large resort – the original architecture which includes a chapel speaks for itself. All rooms are equipped with air conditioning, satellite TV with integrated DVD-player, mini bar (for supplement), safe (on charge), bathroom with hairdryer, furnished terrace or balcony and more. The total surface of 48.000 m2, includes about 10.300 m2 of subtropical garden area with two splendid swimming pools (heated in winter) and whirlpools, kid's pool, kid's playground, solarium with sun beds, mattresses, umbrellas, and pool restaurant with terrace. This luxury resort offers a buffet restaurant, a-la-carte restaurant "Los Guayres," 3 bars, Discobar, Kiosque, a meeting room, a TV room, an internet and reading room (Internet on charge), Wellness and Spa Center "Spa Inagua" (for supplement, entrance up to 18 years old) and a large variety of sport activities (squash, bowling alley, multi-sport field, gym, ping pong, darts, boccia, garden chess, aerobics, aqua gym...). Some activities may be on charge. The Hotel Cordial Mogan Playa is a unique combination of a luxury vacational resort with an authentic Spanish atmosphere in a peaceful and beautiful surrounding. The wonderful subtropical climate allows the visitor to enjoy water sport activities and to play golf all year round. • In January 2009 opened the international Dive Company. Extra Divers is based within the hotel offering dive courses and excursions• In March 2009 the archeological park "Las Crucecitas" was inaugurated. It forms part of the hotel and shows newest remains and findings of the ancient burial grounds of the Guanches• In November 2011 opened "Hike & Bike" offering bike rental, excursions etc.• WiFi free of charge in whole hotel area.
